    • Method Detail

      • connectToDB

        public static boolean connectToDB(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> data)
        sets the connection to the DB
        Parameters:
        data - ArrayList cell [0]: server URL, cell [1]: server port (default for mySQL is 3306), cell [2]: name of the DB scheme, cell [3]: user name cell, [4]: password
        Returns:
        T/F

      • disconnectFromDB

        public static boolean disconnectFromDB()
        connection to DB status. NOTE: make sure that you have an open connection before calling this method
        Returns:
        true if connection closed successfully, false if failed

      • insert

        public static boolean insert(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> data)
        Parameters:
        data - ArrayList cell [0]: command (in this case will always be "insert") cell [1]: table name to insert to string cell [2]: values that should be inserted NOTE: insert only full rows!
        Returns:
        true if update successful, false if failed

      • delete

        public static boolean delete(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> data)
        insert query for DB NOTE: insert only full rows!
        Parameters:
        data - ArrayList cell [0]: command (in this case will always be "delete") cell [1]: table name to delete from, cell [2]: primary key column name of that table, cell [3]: primary key value of the row that need to be deleted,
        Returns:
        true if update successful, false if failed

      • deleteCond

        public static boolean deleteCond(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> data)
        delete query for DB
        Parameters:
        data - ArrayList cell [0]: command (in this case will always be "delete") cell [1]: table name to delete from cell [2]: primary key column name of that table cell [3]: primary key value of the row that need to be deleted
        Returns:
        true if update successful, false if failed

      • update

        update query for DB
        Parameters:
        data - ArrayList cell [0]: command (in this case will always be "update"), cell [1]: table name to update data in cell, [2]: column names and value to put inside them (need to look
        Returns:
        true if update successful, false if failed

      • select

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> select(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> data)
        select query for DB, NOTE: even if you don't want to filter you will need to provide an empty string on cell [3]
        Parameters:
        data - ArrayList cell [0]: command (in this case will always be "select"), cell [1]: table name to select from, cell [2]: columns that you want select to return (example: "*" for all, "ID,email" for those only two columns), cell [3]: condition can contain a filter for a more refine search (example: "WHERE ID='1234'", "" if you don't want a filter), cell [4]: the number of columns that you want select to return (important! provide a string of that number! i.e "7")
        Returns:
        in case of success returns ArrayList that contains ArrayList of Strings -> each ArrayList of string represent a row in the DB replayed all the rows are packed together in an ArrayList that contains ArrayList of strings in case of failure returns null
